intro: Polyalthia liukiuensis, commonly known as the Liuqiu evergreen. It is a flowering plant native to the Ryukyu Islands of Japan, characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy inflorescences. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its delicate, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its bark is smooth and light-colored. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
